priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Genomic Findings Test Detail Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C181180

self.title: CDISC SDTM Genomic Findings Test Detail Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the reportable qualifying the genomic assessment.
name: Genomic Findings Test Detail
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Genomic Findings Test Detail Terminology

terms.definition: The determination of the nucleotide sequence of the allele at a specific locus.
An interpretive summary of the number of replicas of a gene or gene segment within a genome, as compared to a reference or assumed state.
A relative measurement (ratio) of the number of altered copies in the sample to the number of copies in the reference sequence.
The determination of presence or absence of an entity in a specimen.
The absolute number of fragments of genetic material that were detected.
An indication as to whether a genetic sequence is transcribed into RNA.
An interpretive summary of the pattern of genetic transcription.
The determination of the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material at a specific locus.
The overall state or condition of the variability in length of multiple, assessed microsatellite sequences.
A value that is adjusted via a formula or calculation, to facilitate comparison.
A quantitative assessment of the number of sequence variants within a region of interest, which has been normalized.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Normalized Sequence Variants Assessment

terms.definition: The sequence of nucleotides within a genetic region of interest.
The number of affected exons as compared to the reference sequence.
A quantitative assessment of the number of repeating genetic sequences made up of cytosine, adenine, and guanine trinucleotides.
The number of replicas of a particular gene sequence in a genome.
A quantitative assessment of the number of sequence variants within a region of interest.
A relative ranking of the percent of total that the entity would equal or exceed.
An inferred amino acid modification, based on sequence analysis of a genetic variation.
An inferred coding sequence modification, based on sequence analysis of a genetic variation.
A description of the inferred nucleotide sequence at one or more paired loci.
An indication as to whether the genomic variation product retains the original reading frame, as inferred from the coding sequence.
An inferred number of repeating genetic sequences made up of cytosine, adenine, and guanine trinucleotides.
The observable characteristics as inferred from changes in the underlying genomic material.
The total number of times a particular locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced.
The first or primary gene involved in the sequence rearrangement.
The second gene involved in the sequence rearrangement.
A categorization of the phenotypic or clinical significance of the genetic rearrangement.
The characterization or classification of the structural changes to the gene(s) as a consequence of the rearrangement.
A number or range of numeric values that assess and order a result or response for purposes of comparison.
A categorization of the phenotypic or clinical significance of the genomic variation.
The number of times a particular variant within a locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the variant read depth to total read depth.
terms.preferredTerm: Variant Read Depth to Read Depth

terms.definition: An interpretive summary of the magnitude of the variant burden within the tumor.
